title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Tuesday 28 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: man charged with ana rebelo murder .
jersey students could get grant to cover all tuition fees .
rnli starts recruitment for new st helier crew .
states of guernsey launched 'cyber security strategy ' .
gender neutral toilets in guernsey schools 'reducing bullying ' .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for today .
we 'll be back on wednesday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: oxfam says channel islands should be on eu blacklist
text: the charity oxfam has renewed calls for the channel islands to be featured on an eu tax blacklist in a report published today .
the report names 35 countries oxfam believes should feature according to the eu definition of a tax haven .
while guernsey is n't on the oxfam list of 35 countries , it does feature on a list of 14 jurisdictions found to have a 0 % tax rate , which oxfam says presents a risk to the eu and other countries .
the report was published ahead of the eu tax blacklist which is due to be published next week .
a states spokesperson said : `` jersey complies with the standards set by international authorities like the eu , the g20 and the oecd .
`` these standards reflect a global move towards greater transparency and regulation in financial services .

`` by adopting them , jersey continues to show its ongoing commitment to maintaining high levels of compliance and professionalism in these areas , which the oecd recognised this month in rating jersey as 'fully compliant ' with global standards on tax transparency and information exchange . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: states rejects tax reduction for large retailers
text: the states has rejected an attempt to reduce the amount of tax jersey 's largest retailers may have to pay .
the budget debate includes measures to charge 20 % on profits over £ 500,000 from around 20 of the island 's largest retailers .
former treasury minister senator philip ozouf wanted the states to reduce that to 10 % and introduce other measures including cutting the duty free allowance on cigarettes .
but ministers said they 'd review that proposal and other measures he suggested .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: evening weather : chilly and showers
text: clear periods and still a few showers with a chilly northwest breeze .
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f )
jersey
guernsey
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: jersey drops plans for means tested nursery places
text: plans to means test nursery places for children in higher income families will no longer go ahead after a decision by the education minister to withdraw the plans .

deputy rod bryans said he took the decision to withdraw the means testing plan after a report by the early years childhood partnership stressed the importance of high quality nursery education for all children .
politicians agreed the means-testing while debating the medium term financial plan earlier this year and it was due to be implemented by september 2018 .

deputy bryans said there is still a lot of work needed to get the provision of early years education right but decided to remove the means-testing plan to give parents more certainty over what is happening .
currently every three and four year old is given 20 hours free nursery care , whether in a private or states-run school nursery .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'save the eisteddfod '
text: a call for public support and sponsorship is being made by the organisers of the guernsey eisteddfod after they suffered a substantial loss at this year 's festival .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: women 's equality party head in jersey
text: the leader of a political party founded by broadcaster sandy toksvig has been in jersey today to inspire more women to get into politics .
sophie walker of the uk 's women 's equality party hopes to help the states increase the number of women in the assembly .
currently only 12 of the 49 politicians are female .
ms walker has been invited to the island by states officials , the women 's group , the jersey soroptomists and the community relations trust .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: states vote to charge higher duty for high emission vehicles
text: vehicles that produce a higher rate of pollution could be charged more duty than those emitting less pollution .
politicians are voting on the 2018 budget and one of the amendments was to increase vehicle emissions duty at a higher rate for more polluting vehicles .
constable of grouville , john le maistre , said he proposed the change as a way to improve air quality in st helier .
he said it would hopefully encourage people to chose low emission or electric vehicles when they change their car .
the change is dependent on the budget as a whole being approved .
you can listen to the debate on the bbc news site .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: ana rebelo : man charged with murder
text: a 58-year-old man has been charged with the murder of his wife in jersey .
alfredo da costa rebelo , of victoria street , st helier , is accused of killing ana rebelo ( on 4 april .
mrs rebelo 's body was found in her home in victoria street .
the charge came after an investigation by states of jersey police that lasted several months .
mr rebelo appeared in st helier magistrate 's court earlier and is due appear in the court again on 20 december .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: states debating tax on betting shops
text: taxing betting shops in jersey could lead to local shops closing and drive gambling underground , according to an island minister .
deputy murray norton described a budget amendment to tax larger betting shop profits 10 % by former treasury minister , senator philip ozouf as a risk to local companies .

the amendment by senator ozouf also includes cutting the duty free allowance on cigarettes , extending a proposed retail tax to liquor vendors , a new stamp duty of 10 % on residential properties sold for more than £ 10m to people new to jersey and reducing the proposed retail tax from 20 % to 10 % .
politicians are currently debating the 2018 budget .
it is one of a number of amendments that have to be approved before they can start the main budget debate .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: firefighters start rnli lifeboat training
text: firefighters in jersey have started training with the rnli so they can help crew the st helier inshore lifeboat .

they join a team of new volunteer recruits that hope to form a new crew for the lifeboat station after the previous crew was sacked by the rnli when the charity closed the station earlier this month .
firefighters & volunteers training on the st helier inshore lifeboat today .
the rnli want more people to join .
author: Emma Chambers
BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: states plan rise in guernsey taxi fares
text: it could cost more to use a taxi in guernsey under plans to increase fares by the committee for environment and infrastructure .
the proposals will mean some fares will remain the same whilst others will go up in 20p intervals .
the plans are being put out to public consultation .
if introduced , a two-mile journey on tariff one will not increase and would remain at £ 6.60 , but a two-mile journey on tariff two would go up by 20p to £ 9.20 .
it will be the first increase in taxi fares since 2015 and would be a 2.5 % rise on the maximum fare .
the changes could be introduced from monday 18 december 2017 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: means-testing for nursery education is dropped
text: proposals to means-test funding for nursery education have been scrapped in a dramatic u-turn by jersey 's education minister rod bryans .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: elderly woman in hospital after being 'hit by cyclist '
text: an elderly woman is still in jersey general hospital after being hit by a cyclist while crossing the road in st brelade on sunday .
the pedestrian and cyclist sustained injuries but the pedestrian had to be taken to hospital by ambulance .
she was crossing the road at a crossing near red houses opposite waitrose at about 10:40 .
nobody involved has been named by police and officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: tuition fee grant 'will help create an educated workforce '
text: plans to provide a grant to cover the cost of tuition fees for all jersey students in households earning under £ 150,000 per year will `` help create an educated workforce '' according to the education minister .
the proposals , in the 2018 budget , will be funded in part by removing the higher tax allowance for parents with children at university .
there will also be a grant of up to £ 6,500 per year available to help cover the cost of living for students in households earning under £ 95,000 .
[ this ] supports our strategic objective of developing a highly-skilled workforce .
we want to support our young people to acquire the qualifications they need to thrive in an increasingly-competitive environment .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: states give nearly £ 500,000 for internet device scheme
text: digital jersey , the body responsible for promoting the island 's technology industry , is being given £ 449,000 by the states to set up an internet of things lab in the island .
the plan is to encourage companies to test new products in jersey , making use of the island 's fast internet speeds and fast mobile network .

the internet of things ( iot ) is made up of physical devices , home appliances , vehicles and other items designed to communicate with each other and the internet without needing to be connected to a phone or computer .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey police warning over potential scam
text: guernsey police are warning people that if they get a message from someone claiming to be natwest about an online purchase not to `` click any links '' .
we have been made aware or a potential scam text that may be received by people in guernsey .
it appears to be from natwest , advising of a payment made via debit card .
if you receive it , do not click on any links , or dial the numbers contained in the message .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: more than 100 weapons handed to jersey police
text: states of jersey police had more than 100 items handed in as part of `` operation aztec '' aimed at getting dangerous weapons out of homes .
thank you to everyone who took part in operation aztec , the firearms surrender that concluded on sunday .
108 items were handed into us in total including ; 33 shotguns , 8 rifles , 16 air rifles , 16 pistols , 11 air pistols and 1 black powder pistol .
yeah , but we had a bat'leth here !

documents.title: states of guernsey launch 'cyber security strategy '
text: a new plan has been published by the states of guernsey to protect islanders and local businesses from cyber attacks .
the committee for home affairs says the island must ensure it has the strongest possible grounding in cyber security if it is to continue to thrive as a stable and prosperous economy .
the committee says guernsey is a digitised society and technology drives every part of island life from social interaction through healthcare to education and business .
the new cyber security strategy is designed to ensure the island is as prepared as possible to combat those threats , it added .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: breakingman charged with ana rebelo murder
text: a man has been charged with the murder of 51-year-old ana rebelo who was found dead at an address in victoria street , st helier on 4 april .
alfredo da costa rebelo , 58 , was charged with her murder this morning and will appear in the magistrate 's court later .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: student maintenance grant limit could be increased
text: students planning to go to university from jersey could get a maintenance grant to help with living expenses under plans by the treasury minister .
senator alan maclean already announced plans to provide a grant to cover all tuition fees for students in households with an income under £ 150,000 as part of the 2018 budget .
this would cover the full cost of tuition , £ 9,500 per year and additional costs for courses such as medicine .

the current maintenance grant is available to students with an income up to £ 63,500 , this limit could be increased to £ 95,000 with the total value of the grant gradually reducing the closer the income is to the cut off .
this is assuming the 2018 budget is approved by the states assembly .
senator maclean said the plans `` will avoid burdeningour students and their families with additional debt '' .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: kuttelwascher will go if not appointed president
text: economic development vice-president jan kuttelwascher will bid to replace peter ferbrache as the committee 's head - but will follow the outgoing president out the door if he is unsuccessful .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: breakingjersey students could get grant to cover all tuition fees
text: students in jersey could get a grant to cover all of their tuition fees under plans by the treasury minister in the 2018 budget .
senator alan maclean announced today that students in households with an income of less than £ 150,000 will have a grant for 100 % of tuition fees .
those in households earning £ 150,000 and above will receive 50 % of tuition fees as a grant .
this is dependent on the 2018 budget being approved by the states assembly .
previously , grants were only available to students in lower income households and did not cover the full tuition fees .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: smartphone parking available at on-street sites
text: drivers in jersey can now use their mobile phone to pay for on-street parking as well as the traditional parking cards .
the paybyphone scheme was originally tested at green street car park earlier this year and was then rolled out to all car parks last month .
the scheme involved downloading a smartphone app and registering .
each car park or area in the island has a unique code that you enter when paying .
the infrastructure department says this is in addition to other payment options so if a driver does n't have a smartphone they can still park .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: pet revived by firefighters after house blaze
text: a cat was revived by firefighters using a specialist pet oxygen mask after a blaze tore through a kitchen at a property in st clement , in jersey .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: reducing number of overweight pupils 'will take years '
text: reducing the number of children that start school overweight or obese will take between five and 10 years , the founder of a charity which delivers healthy-eating programmes has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: guernsey post on target for 'busiest ever december '
text: guernsey post is on track for december to be its busiest month to date , delivering more than 250,000 items .
yesterday four tons ( 3,600kg ) of post arrived into the island on the mail plane which needed to be sorted and delivered .
sorting officer , mark henry , says they are better prepared than ever and have had to take on extra temporary staff to manage the load .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: jersey politicians begin 2018 budget debate
text: funding for higher education , a tax on large retailers and the usual cigarette and alcohol duty changes are all on the agenda today as politicians in jersey debate the 2018 budget .

treasury minister , senator alan maclean is expected to outline new measures to fund higher education for students , something that has been up for discussion since the uk voted to increase tuition fees to £ 9,000 .
there are no uk style student loans available and only a small number of students from lower income families qualify for a grant .
you can listen to the debate live on 1026mw in jersey or on the bbc news budget debate page .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'one in six jersey crimes involve alcohol '
text: one in six crimes recorded in jersey involve alcohol , according to a report examining islander 's drinking habits .
although the report found people were drinking less than 10 years ago , about a quarter of drinkers were found to be drinking at harmful or dangerous levels .
it found 2 % of all deaths in jersey were alcohol related and 20,000 days of sickness and invalidity benefit were claimed for alcoholism in 2016 .
the states will debate whether raising duty on alcoholic drinks popular with young people should be increased .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: gender neutral toilets in guernsey schools 'reducing bullying '
text: the introduction of more gender neutral toilets in guernsey schools is helping to reduce bullying , says equality charity liberate .
ellie jones , from the charity , says more schools are following moves in the uk to create communal cubicles and sinks .
ms jones says this reduces the amount of enclosed spaces where bullying could take place .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: postcard arrives after five months
text: a guernsey resident had a shock when a postcard from france arrived five months after it was posted .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: today 's weather : chilly breeze and showers
text: a chilly northwest breeze will bring a mixture of sunshine and showers across the channel islands through today .
the showers could be occasionally heavy with hail .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
jersey
guernsey
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rnli starts recruitment for new st helier crew
text: recruitment of a new crew and volunteers for the st helier lifeboat station will start today by the rnli .
the former crew resigned earlier in the month and have said they want to form a new lifeboat service independent of the charity .
the rnli says more than 25 people have come forward so far in the hope of forming the new crew , but they are looking for up to 30 volunteers .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: local live in the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live for the channel islands .
stay with us for all the latest news , weather , travel , and sport .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online
